Geodesic solver

Null Geodesics

Null geodesics in a spacetime geometry described by a metric $g_{μν}$ are described by the Hamiltonian:

\[H = \frac{1}{2} g^{μν} p_μ p_ν\]

and the associated Hamilton equations:

\[\frac{dx^μ}{dλ} = \frac{∂H}{∂p_μ}\]

\[\frac{dp_μ}{dλ} = - \frac{∂H}{∂x^μ}.\]

The conjugate momenta $p_μ$ are defined as:

\[p_μ := g_{μν} \frac{dx^ν}{dλ},\]

and for null geodesics, the initial data satisfies:

\[\left.δ{^i}{_μ} \frac{dx^μ}{dλ}\right|_{λ=0} = {\bf v}^i\]

\[\left. g_{μν}({x}_0) \frac{dx^μ}{dλ}\frac{dx^ν}{dλ} \right|_{λ=0} = 0.\]

The solution to Hamilton's equations is formally given by $x^μ=x^μ(λ,{x}_0,{\bf v})$, and since $λ$ (being an affine parameter) can be redefined linearly, it is appropriate to set up the problem so that $λ∈[0,1]$, with $λ=0$ being the initial point and $λ=1$ is the final point.

Implementation

Hamiltonian

The Hamiltonian function takes the form:

squirrel.HamGeo — Function
HamGeo( Z::RealVec , gfunc::Function )

The HamGeo function computes the geodesic Hamiltonian $H = rac{1}{2} g^{μν} p_μ p_ν$ from the metric $g_{μν}$ provided in the function gfunc and the spacetime position x and momentum p encoded in Z=(x,p).

Hamilton's equations

Hamilton's equations may be written in terms of the phase space coordinate $z^α$, where $z=(x,p)$.

\[\frac{dz^α}{dλ} = J^{αβ} \frac{∂H}{∂z^β}.\]

where $J^{αβ}$ is the symplectic matrix, which has the form:

\[J = \left[ \begin{array}{cccc} O & I \\ -I & O \end{array} \right].\]

Initial data

squirrel.nullenforcerp — Function
nullenforcerp( V0::RealVec , X::RealVec , gfunc::Function )

The nullenforcerp function takes a vector V0 and modifies the time or first component so that it is null at the point X with respect to gfunc and past directed; the function returns the modified vector.
